alert.note: Alert for St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 7:23PM CST until February 01 at 9:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River Near Holden affecting Livingston Parish. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River at Liverpool affecting St. Helena Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tickfaw River at Liverpool. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Low lying roads and buildings near the river along with pasture and crop land will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet tomorrow morning, then begin falling. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
